data: A person who differed from the local wayfarers was climbing the steep road which leads through the sea-skirted townlet definable as the Street of Wells, and forms a pass into that Gibraltar of Wessex, the singular peninsula once an island, and still called such, that stretches out like the head of a bird into the English Channel.
Street of Wells | Gibraltar of Wessex | English Channel
The Well-Beloved: A Sketch of a Temperament
